body.p: Part 3 of my OpenSSH key management series has appeared on IBM developerWorks. In it, I introduce OpenSSH's authentication agent forwarding abilities, which allow you to take advantage of an ssh-agent running on another, more trusted system. Authentication forwarding comes in really handy for making secure, passwordless connections from systems that may be vulnerable to security breaches. Thanks to Charles Karney of Sarnoff Corporation for introducing OpenSSH's authentication forwarding features to me.
